* Take initiative to address customer needs and drive results.



  





**What should you bring along?** 



* At least one year of proven experience in customer service with strong interpersonal skills.
* In-depth knowledge of the automotive market, particularly BMW/MINI and fleet-specific requirements.
* Familiarity with Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) calculations.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* A proactive, organized, and flexible approach to managing a diverse range of tasks.



  





**To succeed in this role, we believe you are:** 



* Result-oriented with a high degree of initiative and independence.
* Passionate about delivering exceptional service to customers and colleagues.
* A strong team player with a positive attitude and the ability to build trust.
* Outgoing and responsive, enjoying daily interactions with customers, drivers, dealers, and colleagues.
* Capable of taking responsibility and working effectively both individually and as part of a team.



  





**What can you look forward to?** 




 Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.
 



  





 This is a permanent position located in Sollentuna, the premises are modern and include a lunch restaurant as well as access to a gym and group training classes. If you find this interesting and you’re bringing the right mind-set in combination with a good skill set, please don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 At the BMW Group, we place great importance on equal treatment and equal opportunities. Our recruiting decisions are based on the personality, experience, and skills of the applicants.

title: Senior IT-tekniker till Bold Printing
description:
**Bold Printing i Stockholm söker en senior IT-tekniker med erfarenhet av IT-drift i produktionsmiljö. Du får arbeta med drift, underhåll och utveckling av vår IT-miljö, med fokus på nätverk, servrar, säkerhet och automatisering i en modern grafisk verksamhet.**
**Om Oss**
 Bold Printing ingår i Bonnier News-koncernen tillsammans med tryckerierna Bold Printing Stockholm, Bold Printing Malmö, Bold Printing Mitt och Bold Printing Jönköping. Vår anläggning i Stockholm har cirka 110 medarbetare.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Rollen som senior IT-tekniker innebär ett övergripande ansvar för att säkra, underhålla, övervaka och utveckla IT-miljön i en grafisk produktionsmiljö. Du kommer att arbeta både operativt och strategiskt för att säkerställa driftsäkerhet, produktivitet och digital utveckling, med särskild hänsyn till system som stödjer en automatiserad process.
   

  

***Dina främsta arbetsuppgifterna är***
* Drift, underhåll och felsökning av servrar och arbetsstationer (Windows/macOS/Linux)
* Drift, underhåll och felsökning av nätverk (brandväggar, switchar och policies)
* Hantering av produktionsspecifika system, Systemövervakning och logghantering
* Säkerhets- och backup-strategier
* Automatisering av arbetsflöden i tryck- och process-miljöer
* Teknisk support och rådgivning till både produktion och kontor
* Medverka i och leda IT-relaterade projekt, uppgraderingar och migreringar
* Integration mellan affärssystem (t.ex. ERP) och produktionssystem


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad, arbetar självständigt men har lätt för samarbete. Du är kommunikativ och pedagogisk i kontakten med användare, har förmåga att prioritera flera uppgifter samtidigt och brinner för teknik och digitalisering i en traditionell industri.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, teknik eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av IT-drift i produktionsmiljö
* God kunskap inom nätverk (TCP/IP, VLAN, brandväggar)
* Erfarenhet av Windows Server, Active Directory och GPO
* Erfarenhet av switchar och brandväggar
* Erfarenhet av lagringslösningar (NAS/SAN)
* Erfarenhet av backup- och återställningssystem
* Erfarenhet av klienthantering


 Meriterande
   

  

* Bred erfarenhet av även äldre operativsystem och styrsystem
* Erfarenhet av övervakningssystem och logghantering
* Erfarenhet av automatisering
* Kännedom om produktionssystem inom grafisk industri (t.ex. Kodak Prinergy)
* Automatisering via skript (t.ex. PowerShell, Bash)
* Erfarenhet av molntjänster (Azure, M365)
* Kunskap om ITIL-ramverk


**Övrig Information**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som börjar med en 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra BPS IT. Du rapporterar till teknisk chef och tillsammans sitter vi på Esbogatan 11, Akalla/Kista.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Björn Dahlberg,
   

  

 För att få reda på mer om vår rekryteringsprocess, klicka

title: IT Project Manager (temp)
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

* This is a temporary position for 11 months with a possibility for extension starting from August/September 2025\*\*


**What you’ll do:**
 We are looking for an experienced IT Project Manager to help drive and support the delivery of our strategic IT initiatives. Our ambition is to increase our overall digital presence and provide a best-in-class digital experience for our customers. Your focus as an IT Project Manager will be to drive and support two major technology transformations in our retail environment: a business-critical ERP migration and the implementation of an Order Management System (OMS). This role is key to aligning our IT roadmap with the evolving demands of omnichannel retail and supply chain operations.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Support an ongoing ERP migration, ensuring minimal disruption to our Ecom operations, including merchandising, finance, and supply chain.
* Investigate the feasibility of different OMS solutions, supporting the selection process through stakeholder input, technical evaluation, and business impact analysis.
* Partner closely with our IT Department, Operations, Customer Service, Finance, and external vendors to ensure IT project alignment with business objectives.
* Identify and mitigate risks, manage scope changes, and maintain tight control on project deliverables and timelines.


**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* Project Management: You have the ability to plan, lead and execute approved development projects together with internal and external resources
* Hands-on experience delivering large-scale ERP and/or OMS implementations. Preferably Microsoft Dynamics 365.
* Strong understanding of retail workflows, including order processing, inventory management, POS integration, and customer fulfillment.
* You have a “go-getter” attitude, you are motivated by the possibility of driving change and projects on your own initiative. Further you have a customer centric mindset and take pride in solving customer needs/problems.
* You are organized and able to gather and document user needs and product information that you can transform into technical requirements to be developed.
* Minimum 5 years experience of working with complex IT-projects, ideally within the retail sector.
* Degree within IT/Computer Science or Management


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: IT-specialist/Systemadministratör SCADA system
description:
**Med människor i fokus och rötter i traditionell automation är vi en av Sveriges ledande leverantörer av resurseffektiviserande system för energi, infra och industri. Vi tar ett helhetsansvar för både stora och mindre projekt med el, kraft och automation. Vi levererar även hela anläggningar där vi utöver våra automationslösningar tar ett totalansvar - människor, montagelösningar och mekanik. Genom att kombinera projektförmåga, branschkunnande och teknisk kompetens, skapar vi framgång och utveckling för både medarbetare och kunder. Våra resurser har vi samlade i eget hus vilket ger oss en värdefull samverkan och kontinuitet i projekten. För oss handlar projektförmåga om att skapa konkurrenskraft åt och tillsammans med våra kunder. Överallt där industriproduktion effektiviseras och utvecklas har Granitor Systems en naturlig och viktig roll att spela.**
 Vår kund behöver nu förstärka sin linjeorganisation med en IT-specialister/systemadministratörer i en förvaltningsorganisation som har nära samarbete med verksamheten med ansvar att förvalta av vårt nuvarande SCADA/EMS-system.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifterna Ingår**
* Leda felsökning vid incidenter samt agera support och stöd till andra system, Kundens verksamhet samt externa parter.
* Utveckling och kodning av applikationsmodulerna utförs av leverantören, men man behöver kunna skriva skript och hantera manuella SQL-databasoperationer i syfte att bistå i manuell driftsättning, testning och felsökning
* Det ingår också att löpande säkerställa att tekniska förändringar i applikationen inte påverkar driftsäkerhet, IT-säkerhet och befintliga funktioner
* I rollen ingår att säkra leverans och drift av SCADA/EMS-system inklusive underhåll och övervakning. Man kommer också delta i arbete med uppgraderingar och systemförbättringar.
* Tillsammans med teamet bidrar man även till att kontinuerligt utveckla det egna teamets aktiviteter och processer


**Beredskap**
 Beredskap kan komma att innebära att man kommer att ingå i beredskapruppering och har då beredskap under en vecka, normalt torsdag till torsdag. Hur ofta detta sker är beroende av antal personer i teamet, vanligtvis var sjätte till åttonde vecka.
   

  

**Vem Söker Vi**
* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning med inriktning mot IT alternativt civilingenjör.


**Kompetens Och Erfarenhet**
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med komplexa IT-miljöer baserade på Linux/Unix.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med verksamhetskritiska eller driftkritiska IT-system (t.ex. styrning och övervakning i realtid).
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med applikations- och systemadministration.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete inom myndighet eller annan offentlig verksamhet


**Bra Att Veta**
* Placering: Sundbyberg
* Omfattning: heltidstjänst
* Säkerhetsprövning: Säkerhetsprövning av kandidaten kan komma att krävas!
* Tjänsteresor förekommer


**Kontaktperson**
 Siamak Hashemi (Gruppchef), siamak.hashemi@granitor.se
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
* Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så sök nu!
* Vi önskar vänligen men bestämt att inte bli kontaktade av säljare.


 Granitor Systems AB är en del av Granitor-gruppen, en svensk företagsgrupp som är verksam inom fastighetsutveckling och förvaltning, entreprenad, konsult och underhåll samt tillväxtinvesteringar i utvecklingsbolag. Här jobbar 3300 medarbetare som tillsammans skapar välmående samhällen och industrier. Granitor-gruppen hade 2023 en omsättning på 7500 MSEK.

title: Retail Performance & Contract anager
description:
At BMW Group, everything starts with passion. It turns a profession into a vocation. It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued. It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work unite that we can shape the future together.
 



  





 We are looking for a new Retail Performance & Contract manager.
 



  





 As a Retail Performance & Contract manager, you will be responsible for the monitoring of retail network and our authorized partners financial and contractual performance within the legal entities of the Sales company - NSC.
 



  





 Together with the team in Retail Development department, you will support our authorized partners with implementation of strategic initiatives for the future in the automotive industry. You will work closely together with the colleagues in the departments and with our local Nordic markets (Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland and the Baltics) as well as other internal stakeholders within the BMW Group Northern Europe with the focus of building a strong and viable business for the future of automotive retail.
 



  





 What awaits you?
 


* Contract management for the authorized BMW/MINI network in the Nordic region.
* Contractual coordination as part of the introduction of the BMW Agency model in the region (including contractual structures, reimbursements, guidelines/processes and further roll-out topics together with the Agency project team).
* Performance follow-up alignment with the existing contractual formats currently in operation together with the Nordic markets.
* Contractual compliance related topics including training, awareness and implementation of relevant contractual compliance schemes.
* Financial compliance (management and enforcement of collateral requirements).
* Support in other strategic projects as relevant from time to time within the area of Retail and Business development for BMW and MINI in the Nordics.



  





 What should you bring along?
 


* Experience and interest in operational contract management, preferably with a legal background and a degree in law.
* Genuine interest in financial analytical reviews as well as KPI steering and follow-up.
* Excellent verbal and written communication in English and Swedish/Nordic languages.



  





 To succeed in this role, we believe you are:
 


* Focused and organized, delivering high-quality work while excelling at self-leadership in a fast-paced environment.
* Ensures quality in deliveries and fulfills commitments, even in high-paced situations that require shifting focus between different tasks and projects.
* Structured, driven, positive, committed, and communicative, as well as a natural team-player
* Maintains a flexible mindset with the ability to work on multiple tasks, handle short deadlines, and problem-solve.
* Able to structure and plan your work on a daily basis to deliver high-quality results, even on short deadlines.



  





 What you can look forward to?
 



 Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.
 



  





 This is a permanent position located in Sollentuna, the premises are modern and include a lunch restaurant as well as access to a gym and group training classes. If you find this interesting and you’re bringing the right mind-set in combination with a good skill set, please don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 At the BMW Group, we place great importance on equal treatment and equal opportunities. Our recruiting decisions are based on the personality, experience, and skills of the applicants.

title: Head of Technology Finance Management
description:
**Job ID: 30118**
 We are looking for a Head of Technology Finance Management who has an experience in Finance Business Partner role with a robust understanding of Technology. You will lead and support the finance and performance management agenda of Group Technology, participate in setting the strategic direction to meet financial and business targets and facilitate planning, identification of cost drivers and impacts to business stakeholders.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 As part of Group Finance, the Tech Financial Partnering team is the trusted advisor and strategic finance partner to Group Technology and its stakeholders at Nordea. You will join a team of dedicated and experienced Finance Partners with a global footprint across Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Poland. With ample opportunities to improve and establish new ways of working, you will have a truly rewarding journey at Nordea.
   

  

 You will be leading a team of 6 to 7 people whose roles span across strategy, program Financial management, allocations and reporting. You as a leader play a key role in developing and supporting your team members to reach their aspirations and unleash their full potential.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Develop and maintain robust model for Technology cost transparency & drivers, and their impact on Business stakeholders
* Partner with Group Technology & Group Finance during Target setting process, target distribution modelling, planning and forecasting
* Liaison with Business Areas to understand requirements and partner to support with valuable insights to drive results
* Strong understanding of profit and loss, balance sheet, capex and opex
* Business Case and Project Management
* Support identification of areas to meet Technology cost target plans
* Ensure monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc cost control, providing meaningful insights and comments including mitigation actions
* Mentoring and management of team performance and development


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you enjoy working with a global team, in an evolving/dynamic environment while being comfortable with ambiguity and have the ability to get things done, with focus on solutions and deliverables
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* At least 10-12 years of experience as Finance Business Partner, with focus on Technology
* Experience with Technology Charging Models and Transfer Pricing principles
* Planning, forecasting, P/L and Balance Sheet management for Group Functions
* Experience with leading and managing a diverse team
* Education in Finance and Accounting is a plus
* Working knowledge of common financial systems, cost center and consolidation standards, MS office tools


**As the Leader you are expected to and have a crucial role in:**
* Creating purpose by translating strategy into operational and actionable plans to showcase how we create value for our customers and impact business priorities
* Empowering people by identifying individual development opportunities to support growth and encourage them to share own ideas, concerns and learnings
* Driving performance by recognising individual contributions and collective victories to maintain a healthy balance through measurable goals and clear priorities for each team member
* Developing teams by nurturing a dynamic team culture, that emphasises trust and respect to ensure that everyone understands their unique value and contribution
* Fostering inclusion by creating equal opportunity through curiosity about all aspects of diversity in your team to evaluate habits and perspectives on a continuous basis


**What We Offer**
 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 18/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Elizabeth Shadrack Paszek at elizabeth.shadrack.paszek@nordea.com.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Är du en vass DevOps Engineer med passion för automation, moln och moderna arbetssätt? Vill du arbeta i en innovativ miljö där teknik och teamwork står i högsta fokus? Om du älskar att effektivisera processer, bygga robusta CI/CD-pipelines och skapa smarta lösningar som gör skillnad – då vill vi höra från dig!** 




  





 Vi på SDNit är ett team av experter inom SecOps, NetOps, DevOps och IT Management. Vi brinner för att överbrygga klyftan mellan utveckling och drift genom att kombinera det bästa av automation, molnteknik och agila arbetssätt. Vi tror på kraften i samarbete och ständig utveckling – både teknisk och personlig – och erbjuder en arbetsplats där du får växa tillsammans med andra passionerade och kompetenta konsulter.
 



  





  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 




 Som DevOps-konsult hos SDNit kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att hjälpa våra kunder att införa och vidareutveckla moderna DevOps-principer och lösningar. Rollen är både strategisk och operativ, där du får arbeta med allt från arkitektur och design till implementation, felsökning och förbättringsarbete. Du får stora möjligheter att påverka teknikval och arbetssätt – i nära samarbete med kundens team.
 



  





  





**Ditt ansvarsområde:** 



* Design och implementation av
 **CI/CD-pipelines** 
 med verktyg som
 **GitLab CI/CD,** 
**GitHub Actions** 
 eller
 **Jenkins** 
 .
* Infrastrukturautomation med verktyg som
 **Ansible** 
 ,
 **Terraform** 
 eller
 **Pulumi** 
 .
* Molnarkitektur och drift i miljöer som
 **AWS** 
 ,
 **Azure** 
 eller
 **Google Cloud** 
 .
* Containerisering och orkestrering med
 **Docker** 
 och
 **Kubernetes** 
 .
* Övervakning, logghantering och incidenthantering med moderna observability-verktyg.
* Stötta och guida utvecklingsteam i DevOps-arbete, automation och bästa praxis.



  





  





**KOMPETENSER** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* 3+ års erfarenhet i en DevOps-roll, med dokumenterad erfarenhet av automation, drift och utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg som
 **GitLab CI/CD,** 
**Jenkins** 
 ,
 **GitHub Actions** 
 eller liknande.
* Vana att arbeta i molnmiljöer (
 **AWS** 
 ,
 **Azure** 
 ,
 **GCP** 
 ).
* Kunskap om konfigurationshantering och Infrastructure as Code (t.ex.
 **Ansible,** 
**Terraform** 
 ,
 **Puppet** 
 ).
* Programmering- eller scriptingkunskaper i t.ex.
 **Python** 
 ,
 **Bash** 
 eller
 **Go** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av containerteknologi
 **(Docker)** 
 och gärna även
 **Kubernetes** 
 .



  





  





**MERITERANDE** 




 Vi ser det som ett plus om du även har:
 


* Intresse för eller erfarenhet av
 **Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)** 
 .
* Kunskap inom observability: t.ex.
 **Prometheus** 
 ,
 **Grafana** 
 ,
 **ELK** 
 ,
 **Datadog** 
 eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av policy-as-code, säkerhetsautomation eller GitOps-verktyg som
 **ArgoCD** 
 eller
 **Flux** 
 .
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team med agil metodik (
 **Scrum** 
 ,
 **Kanban** 
 ).



  





  





**VILKA VI ÄR** 




 På SDNit hittar du ett team som kombinerar djup teknisk expertis med en stark passion för automation, säkerhet och smarta arbetssätt. Vi är konsulter inom DevOps, NetOps, SecOps och IT management – med ett gemensamt fokus på att skapa hållbara, effektiva och moderna lösningar för våra kunder.
 



  





 Vi tror på kraften i innovation, samarbete och ständig utveckling – både för våra kunder och internt. Hos oss får du en arbetsmiljö där du kan växa, påverka och trivas, omgiven av kunniga och engagerade kollegor.
 



  





 Vi satsar på kompetensutveckling, flexibilitet och gemenskap – genom utbildningar, resor och aktiviteter som afterworks och coworking Fridays. Våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste tillgång, och vi strävar efter att bygga en inkluderande, trygg och inspirerande arbetsplats.
 



  





  





**ÄR DU VÅR NÄSTA KOLLEGA?** 




 Skicka in din ansökan med CV till
 **hello@sdnit.se** 
 . Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta vår VD, Stefan Hedenström, på
 **0703 09 02 52** 
 eller
 **stefan.hedenstrom@sdnit.se** 
 .
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: QA Administrator – Data Validation & Reporting
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and methodical QA Administrator to join our IT Analytics team. The Client, a Fortune 500 organization, is undergoing a multi-year global business transformation, consolidating processes into SAP S/4HANA and unifying
 





 enterprise data within our Databricks platform. A key focus will be the development of standardized global dashboards and reports in Power BI.
 





 .
 





 The QA Administrator will focus on working with the project team on validating data in Power BI against source systems (SAP S/4HANA, Databricks, legacy ERP and applications) and ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of reports. Additionally, the role is responsible for creating, managing, and executing System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) documentation in Azure DevOps, as well as tracking and resolving defects with the project technical team.
 




  






 Key Responsibilities:
 





 - Validate Power BI dashboards and reports against SAP S/4HANA, Databricks, and other relevant data sources to ensure alignment with business requirements and mtric definitions and calculations.
 





 - Develop, maintain, and execute SIT and UAT test plans and results in Azure DevOps.
 





 - Log, track, and manage defects in Azure DevOps, ensuring timely resolution and re-testing.
 





 - Collaborate with technical teams to clarify issues, verify fixes, and confirm acceptance criteria are met.
 





 - Maintain clear and detailed testing documentation, including test results, sign-offs, and issue logs.
 





 - Support the enhancement of QA processes and ensure best practices are followed.
 




  





 ﻿
 
 Must haves
 
 Qualifications:
 



 - Proven QA or testing experience, preferably within analytics/reporting or ERP-related projects.
 



 - Familiarity with ERP processes; SAP S/4HANA experience preferred.
 



 - Proficiency in Power BI data validation techniques.
 



 - Strong experience using Azure DevOps for test management and defect tracking.
 



 - Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and commitment to delivering accurate, reliable results.
 



  





 This is an opportunity to ensure the quality and reliability of analytics solutions in a global transformation program. Your work will directly influence the accuracy of business insights and the success of strategic decision-making in a global enterprise.

title: Vi söker en senior IT-tekniker!
description:
*Vill du bidra med teknisk kompetens och ett trevligt kundbemötande har vi en passande tjänst för dig! Vår kund söker nu en ny IT-tekniker som kommer arbeta kundnära i tekniska miljöer och hjälpa deras kunder att hitta smarta lösningar. Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag - vi tillämpar löpande urval.* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vår kund är ett IT-företag som arbetar med helhetsansvar för sina kunders IT-funktioner, infrastruktur och säkerhet. Det vill säga support, drift och förebyggande arbete av såväl verksamhetskritiska system och applikationer, nätverk och datakommunikation, men också det digitala skyddet mot intrång och virus.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Rollen innebär att arbeta med kunders IT-miljöer – på distans och på plats hos kund. Det krävs därför en person som trivs i en roll där teknisk kompetens, service och samarbete står i centrum. Du kommer att ha en varierande vardag där du ibland jobbar tillsammans med kollegor i projekt och ibland tillsammans eller självständigt i drift, felsökning och support. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:
 


* Konfiguration, installation och drift av Windows-servrar och virtualiseringsmiljöer (VMware)
* Konfiguration, installation och drift av nätverksinfrastruktur: brandväggar, switchar och trådlösa nätverk
* Konfiguration och installation av 3:e parts-applikationer (t.ex. Visma, Hogia, Winserv) på server, inklusive fjärråtkomst/RemoteApp-lösning
* Avancerad felsökning och åtgärd
* Stödja kollegor i konfiguration, installation och felsökning
* Rådgivning till kund gällande IT-säkerhet och förbättringar i IT-miljö



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har flera års erfarenhet av Microsoft Windows Server och VMware
* Har erfarenhet av att installera och konfigurera affärsapplikationer
* God förståelse för nätverk, inklusive brandväggar (gärna FortiNet eller Clavister), switchar (HPE/Aruba eller FortiNet) och WiFi
* B-körkort



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet som Global Admin i Microsoft 365 (säkerhetsinställningar, conditional access, Exchange)
* Kunskap inom HPE Storage och drift av lagringsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av att hantera hela VMware-miljöer (server och storage)



  





**Vår rekryteringsprocess** 




 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Vid ansökan efterfrågas ett CV. Personligt brev använder vi inte som urvalsmetod och behöver därför inte bifogas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.

title: Network Development Engineer, InfraComms
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services is looking for a highly motivated and technically savvy Network Development Engineer to help operate, develop and scale one of the world’s largest and most complex networks.
   

  

 Come join the InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a Network Development Engineer (NDE).
   

  

 The InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) is responsible for managing the communication, coordination, and operations related to external networks and carriers.
   

  

 The team maintains balanced partnerships with key industry stakeholders, leveraging their technical expertise to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex network related issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively.
   

  

 The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and theory. They will have experience proactively managing engineering projects, network optimization initiatives and operational network support for a large-scale service provider.
   

  

 As a technical leader, you will manage complex stakeholder operational issues, relationships and develop innovative mechanisms and solutions to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is essential! This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world-class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 As an NDE in the InfraComms team, you will be responsible for:
   

  

 Handling both reactive and proactive operational issues related to AWS's external network services such as PNI, Public Peering, Transit, Embedd Caches, and Backbone.
   

  

 Engaging in advanced triaging for critical services and maintaining ownership of troubleshooting and communication.
   

  

 You will also enhance and develop mechanism to further improve AWS network processes for a better availability and connectivity.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The InfraComms team is composed of experts in the internet ecosystem, with comprehensive knowledge of interconnectivity layers.
   

  

 The team operates on a 24x5 schedule across EU/NA/AP regions, ensuring a superior experience for AWS internal and external customers.
   

  

 You will be working alongside a diverse group of Network Development Engineers from the AMER, APAC, and EMEA regions.
   

  

 By joining the InfraComms team, you will play a crucial role in enhancing AWS's network operations and business development strategies, directly contributing to the improvement of internet infrastructure and the customer experience.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree from in Computer Science or related area.
* Experience with major routing protocols, specifically BGP.
* Experience of optical transport (passive and active Layer 1/WDM) operations and networks, auutomation via Bash/Shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.


**Preferred Qualifications**
 - Master’s degree from in Computer Science or related area -
   

  

* Experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks.
* Experience in routing protocols, network operation and/ or implementation.
* Experience in fiber-optical network designing.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A3005394

title: GRIP Reporter – Scandinavia and EU
description:
**Who we are:**
 For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions. We securely capture and preserve the communications data of the world’s most highly regulated firms, giving them greater visibility and control over their information and ensuring compliance with stringent regulations.
   

  

 Though we offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other perks one would expect from an established company, we are not your typical technology company. Global Relay is a career-building company. A place for big ideas. New challenges. Groundbreaking innovation. It’s a place where you can genuinely make an impact – and be recognized for it.
   

  

 We believe great businesses thrive on diversity, inclusion, and the contributions of all employees. To that end, we recruit candidates from different backgrounds and foster a work environment that encourages employees to collaborate and learn from each other, completely free of barriers.
   

  

**About GRIP:**
 Global Relay is an innovative business and this extends to its approach in developing highly engaging and informative content services for its prospects, customers, partners and employees. GRIP, which is an acronym for Global Relay Intelligence & Practice, was launched in early 2023, is a product in its own right and will be a new revenue line in the near future. GRIP functions with a high degree of editorial autonomy, has its own team and identity, and, being fully supported by Global Relay and its founder, is not held back by the usual foundational obstructions that start-ups have to put in place such as resource, infrastructure, capital and premises. GRIP delivers a modern and practical streamed content service that focuses on informing the C-suite on essential developments, news, and intelligence to enable them to conduct their roles with speed, confidence and precision. The GRIP founding team has considerable experience in this area and has a strong track-record in meeting its business objectives.
   

  

**Your role:**
 With direction from senior GRIP staff you will research, source and create content for publication and/or broadcasting for our specialist information service. You will craft and deliver content that appeals to, informs and stimulates a professional audience. You will be responsible for the expansion of our content coverage of Scandinavia, the Baltics and the EU more generally.
   

  

 You will support the Director, Content and Community in all relevant project work while collaborating directly with a friendly and experienced team based in London and NYC. Because you will be GRIP’s sole team member and our ambassador in Stockholm high levels of motivation and the ability to work independently are both critical. This on-site role reports to the Director, Content and Community in London and is based in Stockholm. Although you will be required in the office full time, significant flexibility to meet with sources, identify leads and contributors and attend events outside of the office will be offered.
   

  

**Your job:**
* Carry out independent research and write timely, informative and insightful articles on key subject areas covered by GRIP (compliance, regulation and technology) with a specific focus on ongoing developments in Scandinavia and the EU
* Develop leads and contacts and maintain close relationships with our professional community in Sweden, Scandinavia and the EU
* Assist with the creation of podcasts for GRIP on a variety of topics pertinent to a global compliance audience
* Assist with all ongoing projects including research reports, our proprietary rules navigator and other assets and functionality being developed
* Ensure that content published out of the Stockholm office meets the high standards expected by a sophisticated and demanding global professional audience
* Work closely with the local sales and marketing team as required
* Help Stockholm office colleagues in preparing for and conducting events for clients and prospects within the corporate and regulatory arenas
* Represent GRIP and GR as required at internal and external corporate events as well as conferences
* Adhere to GR policy and legal and contractual guidelines


**About you:**
* Interest in compliance, regulatory affairs, technology and the legal ecosystem
* Ability to listen to and build rapport with contacts, leads and sources
* Demonstrable ability to produce interesting content for a specialist audience
* A track record of independently generating content that differentiates a publication
* Experience of working autonomously
* Demonstrable research and writing experience and skills set
* Affinity for technology, systems and processes
* Outstanding attention to detail
* Logical thinker with excellent organisational skills
* Natural curiosity and desire to keep learning
* Principled, ethical approach to reporting and pride in one’s work
* High levels of motivation and energy
* Tenacity, determination, integrity and resilience


**Qualifications:**
* 3-5 years of professional work experience as a reporter, technical writer or researcher
* Bachelor’s Degree in relevant discipline


**What you can expect:**
 At Global Relay, there’s no ceiling to what you can achieve. It’s the land of opportunity for the energetic, the intelligent, the driven. You’ll receive the mentoring, coaching, and support you need to reach your career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that breeds creativity and rewards perseverance and hard work. And you’ll be working alongside smart, talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with complementary knowledge and skills.
   

  

 Global Relay is an equal-opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
   

  

 We seek to ensure reasonable adjustments, accommodations, and personal time are tailored to meet the unique needs of every individual.
   

  

 We understand flexible work arrangements are important, and we encourage that in our work culture. Whether it’s flexibility around work hours, workstyle, or lifestyle, we want to ensure our employees have a healthy work/life balance. We support and value a hybrid work model that blends collaboration with the team in the office and focus time from the comfort of your home.
   

  

 To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

title: Sales Executive – Sweden
description:
Would you like to join the leading business technology company in the Nordics? Do you speak both business and technology fluently? If yes, keep reading!
   

  

 Sofigate is growing fast and we are now seeking for a highly motivated deal maker who will change the way people see sales leaders at Sofigate. You are a passionate problem solver and highly motivated to learn and spar together with customers and use your professionalism to find fit-for-purpose solutions creating true business value for the customer.
   

  

 Your ability to convince the stakeholders will consist of both rational and emotional aspects addressing customer’s needs and doubts. You possess a deep curiosity for technology and AI and you already use AI actively in your work.
   

  

 You lead by example and coach customer executives to perform at their best. You also lead our highly talented people at your named customers and inspire them with customers’ mission and objectives.
   

  

 Experience in selling digital transformation programs—ideally linked to technical and digital solutions, with knowledge of platforms like ServiceNow and Salesforce seen as a strong plus—is highly valued. This experience enables you to articulate end-to-end value for the customer by bridging platform capabilities with strategic consulting expertise.
   

  

 Experience from license sales—preferably within the ServiceNow and or Dynatrace ecosystem—is considered a strong advantage, as it enables you to drive end-to-end value from both platform and consulting perspectives.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who thrives as a deal maker—someone with a stellar track record in sales who believes that exceptional performance should be matched by equally exceptional earnings. You understand that true, long-lasting success is never achieved alone; you're a team player who genuinely enjoys celebrating wins together and lifting those around you. What drives you is a passion for your customers’ businesses. You engage in meaningful dialogue and are naturally curious, always seeking to understand and solve the challenges your customers face.
   

  

 Your background speaks volumes: it’s versatile and rooted in experience from growth-focused companies, making you adaptable, driven, and innovative. One of your standout qualities is your ability to build strong relationships, particularly at the C-level. You’re trusted, you communicate clearly and effectively in both Swedish and English, and you know how to foster long-term partnerships that go beyond the transaction.
   

  

 In addition to your experience, you bring with you a strong network—one that includes potential customers, partners, and key industry contacts. This network helps accelerate opportunities from day one. With around ten years of sales experience, including leadership responsibilities, or a strong ambition to grow into such a role, you’re ready to take the lead and make an impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead few strategic accounts and drive +20% annual growth
* Ensure the happiness and engagement of Sofigator colleagues at your named accounts
* Actively identify and pursue new business opportunities
* Build and inspire exceptional customer relationships
* Lead customer executives
* Contribute insights to the development of our service offerings.


**What’s in it for you?**
 Want to work with world-class technologies, best-in-class business technology management practices and a team of experts? You’re in the right place with us.
   

  

 As a Sofigator, you get the opportunity to work with knowledgeable and driven colleagues, develop and challenge yourself and create sustainable value for our customers. We have an international, vibrant and fun culture with great openness and flexibility. We value every Sofigator and strive to build a diverse, equal, and inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice is heard, and where everyone can become the best versions of themselves. We value a healthy work life balance and support you in maintaining it.
   

  

 Growth is not just a corporate thing for us – it is personal. There is so much to explore and learn within our community, and together with our customers, that having a bit of fun is unavoidable.
   

  

**We would like to hear from you**
 Tell us your story and let us know why you are the change maker we are looking for.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact: Robert Lingemark, Country Manager Sweden, robert.lingemark[@]Sofigate.com
   

  

**About Sofigate**
*We are The Business Technology Company with the fastest time-to-value in the gen AI era. We achieve that by combining our transformation expertise with low/no-code platforms and generative AI. That’s how we create sustainable customer value. In practice, that means helping our customers to develop the interplay between business and technology: to design, build and implement transformations and business-friendly technology solutions, like Salesforce, ServiceNow and SAP.*

title: Tech Lead - Frontend
description:
*Tele2 is looking for a Tech Lead for Frontend to help drive the evolution of our digital sales and service platforms within the B2C IT Engineering department. This is a strategic and hands-on role for someone ready to take architectural ownership of our frontend stack, mentor other developers, and help shape our chapter ways of working.*
 Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**This is the job**
 As a Tech Lead for frontend you’ll be the technical and strategic driver of our frontend direction for several teams. You’ll take ownership of architectural decisions, set engineering standards, and work closely with the E2E architecture team to ensure our frontend aligns with Tele2’s long-term platform vision.
   

  

 You’ll lead by example, mentoring developers, guiding implementation, and fostering a culture of high-quality, maintainable code. Your influence will extend across teams and chapters, helping shape how we build, test, and ship modern web experiences.
   

  

 This is a key leadership role where you’ll balance hands-on development with architectural oversight and team coaching. You’ll work closely with backend teams, design and digital product teams to deliver scalable and elegant solutions that power our digital sales and service platforms.
   

  

*This position is based at our headquarters in Kista, Stockholm, with a hybrid work model requiring three days per week in the office.*
**Who are you?**
* A natural technical leader who enjoys building up teams, sharing knowledge, and driving frontend excellence across the organization
* Experienced in leading or contributing to frontend chapters, and motivated to improve ways of working at scale
* A team player who works closely with others from idea to delivery, and values shared ownership over individual heroics
* Passionate about growing people — you coach, mentor, and actively support the development of those around you
* Excited to drive technical direction, set standards, and help align teams on frontend architecture and tooling
* Curious and proactive, with a strong belief in continuous learning, for yourself and the chapter as a whole


**This Is What You Have**
 You’re a technical leader who thrives on solving complex challenges, coaching others, and thinking long-term. You bring:
   

  

* Excited Strong hands-on experience in TypeScript, React and Node.js
* Curious Experience in Astro, MongoDB and Vanilla Extract is a plus
* A deep understanding of frontend architecture, design systems, and component reuse
* Experience working in complex domains with business logic at scale
* Passion for modern engineering practices, collaboration, and continuous improvement

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
*The Basware Customer Success team is a global organization ensuring high-quality delivery and customer experience. Our Customer Success team works closely with our customers creating joint success plans, offering practical guidance to help customers achieve their goals, and allowing them to drive their business outcomes.*
*The team helps to demonstrate the return on investment and acts as a trusted advisor. It's not simply about making the customers content with our products or services, it's about ensuring they are delighted and getting the most out of what we offer.*
*The Customer Success team monitors adoption and health and focuses on helping customers use our products and services effectively. This approach is essential for retaining customers, increasing the value they get over time, and expanding their usage of our solutions. In a nutshell our Customer Success team ensures a healthy and mutually beneficial customer relationship.*
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Customer Success Manager (CSM) to join our growing team. As a key member of our Customer Success organization, you will manage strategic enterprise customers globally, cultivating executive-level relationships, driving product adoption, and ensuring our customers achieve measurable value from their investment in Basware.
   

  

 This role is ideal for a driven individual with a strong blend of sales, relationship management, and SaaS experience who thrives in fast-paced, complex customer environments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Own and manage strategic relationships with a portfolio of global, enterprise customers
* Partner with high-level customer stakeholders (VP and C-level) to align on goals, value realization, and long-term success strategies
* Lead value-based success planning, business reviews, and renewal/expansion discussions
* Identify and execute on opportunities for account growth and expansion, working closely with sales and cross-functional teams
* Confidently navigate complex, matrixed client organizations to ensure stakeholder alignment and sustained value delivery
* Act as a trusted advisor to customers, guiding them through product adoption and process optimization using Basware solutions
* Collaborate with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Services teams to advocate for customer needs and enhance the overall customer experience
* Deliver compelling presentations that communicate Basware’s value proposition and strategic impact to executive stakeholders
* Maintain a deep understanding of the customer’s business and industry to proactively identify success enablers and expansion opportunities


 ,
   

  

* 4+ years of experience managing global, enterprise customer accounts
* Proven experience working with high-level stakeholders (VP+) to build and strengthen business relationships
* Demonstrated track record of driving business expansion within large customer organizations
* Strong experience in strategic, value-based selling and outcome-driven account management
* Exceptional presentation, communication, and relationship-building skills
* Background in Customer Success, Sales, and/or Relationship Management
* Must have experience working within an ERP, Cloud, or Complex SaaS environment
* Comfortable navigating complex, global organizations and managing multiple stakeholder relationships
* Proven ability to grow customer accounts quickly and sustainably
* Strong cross-functional collaboration skills—able to align and influence internal teams across product, sales, and services


 Language skills: English mandatory, Swedish, German or French preferred

title: Communications Outreach Intern
company_industry: Research Services and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**📞 Communications Outreach Intern — Client Relations & Research (Praktik)** 




  





*Are you a confident communicator looking to gain real-world experience in client outreach and relationship building? Do you enjoy connecting with people, conducting research, and explaining ideas clearly across different cultures and time zones?* 




  





 We're hiring interns for
 **Strandvägen Outreach Communications** 
 — the Stockholm client engagement division of Swed Fintech, specializing in relationship management and international communications.
 



  





**🌿 About Us** 




 Strandvägen Outreach Communications
 
 is the client relations arm of Swed Fintech, focused on building professional connections through structured outreach and relationship development. We work with clients across North America and Europe, supporting communication strategies and contact development.
 



  





 As part of the broader Swed Fintech group (which includes partnerships with Swiss Finance Academy and other ventures), we train the next generation of communication professionals and client relationship specialists.
 



  





**✨ What You'll Do** 



* Conduct outbound communication via phone and email with potential clients
* Research client segments and prepare outreach materials
* Assist in developing communication scripts and strategies
* Participate in training sessions and skill-building exercises
* Track communication outcomes and relationship development progress



  





**🌸 This Role Is For You If You:** 



* Are based in Sweden and fluent in English (Swedish helpful but not required)
* Have clear communication skills and are comfortable speaking on phone calls
* Are eager to learn professional communication tools and systems
* Want hands-on experience in client relations and outreach work
* Prefer practical experience over theoretical coursework



  





**🌿 Ideal Candidates Have:** 



* Background in Communications, Media Studies, or related programs requiring practical internship experience
* Comfort with phone-based communication or customer interaction
* Interest in developing professional relationship-building skills



  





**🙏 What We Offer:** 



* Office located on prestigious Östermalm in central Stockholm
* Practical experience with real client communications
* Professional development in relationship building and outreach
* Structured feedback and skill development
* Respected internship experience for your CV



  





 This is an unpaid praktik focused on professional skill development and practical communications experience, suitable for students requiring internship credits as well as others interested in building client reach-out and relationship management skills.
 



  





**To Apply:** 
 Send CV and brief email explaining your interest in client communications work.
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Östermalm office)
 



**Commitment:** 
 Full-time preferred but Part-time considered
 



**Language:** 
 English required, Swedish helpful
 



**Timeline:** 
 Rolling applications
 



 This is Swedish
 **Praktik** 
 : This has an educational and professional development component so it is unpaid.

title: Modig och utvecklingsmotiverad ledare
description:
*Har du mod att gå före och skapa ett Vallentuna där människor och idéer växer?* 
***Vill du vara med och leda utvecklingen av en socialtjänst som gör skillnad för barn och familjer varje dag? Då ska du söka till oss!***
 Vallentuna kommun har mod att gå före. Vår ambition är att ligga i framkant när det gäller innovativa lösningar, smarta arbetssätt och en effektiv organisation. Som ledare har du en viktig roll i utvecklingsarbetet. Kommunen som arbetsplats präglas av ett samförstånd mellan politik och verksamhet, där det gemensamma intresset och ansvaret för Vallentunas bästa lyser igenom. Bemötande, tillgänglighet och kundens fokus är viktigt i vårt arbete för goda resultat och ökad kvalitet.
   

  

 Engagemang, samarbete och allas lika värde ska genomsyra vår organisation. Du som söker bör självklart dela våra gemensamma värderingar.
   

  

**Om Verksamheten**
 Socialförvaltningen söker en enhetschef till Barn och familjeenheten som består av 25 socialsekreterare, två specialistsocionomer, två SSPF-koordinatorer samt tre gruppchefer. Vi har ett öppet arbetsklimat med barnen och dess familjer i centrum och vi satsar på bemötande, kvalitet och rättssäkerhet. Våra framgångsfaktorer är samarbete, hållbara medarbetare, med fokus på förebyggande arbete och verksamhetsutveckling. Kommunen som arbetsplats präglas av ett samförstånd mellan politik och verksamhet, där det gemensamma intresset och ansvaret för Vallentunas bästa är framträdande. Bemötande, tillgänglighet och samverkan är centralt i vårt arbete för att skapa goda resultat och ökad kvalitet.
   

  

 Enheten består av utredningsgruppen för barn samt en för ungdomar samt gruppen med mottagning, SSPF-koordinatorer, familjehemssekreterare och kontaktpersonssekreterare.
   

  

 Enheten leds av en enhetschef tillsammans med tre gruppchefer vilket medför goda förutsättningar för ett nära chefs- och ledarskap. Enheten har ett nära samarbete med vuxenenheten utifrån flera nätverk där enheterna arbetar nära varandra och med kommunens egna öppenvård som är oerhört värdefull för en sammanhållen socialtjänst. Vår myndighetsavdelning uppmuntrar till gemensamma aktiviteter och som enhetschef förväntas du bidra till positiv samverkan och lärande över enheterna.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som enhetschef har du helhetsansvar för enhetens
 **resultat, personal, arbetsmiljö och budget** 
 . Du leder och inspirerar enheten, i nära samverkan med kollegor internt och professionella partners externt.
   

  

 Som enhetschef leder och planerar du verksamheten, där medarbetarna lotsar och motiverar till rätt stöd, utreder, fattar beslut om och följer upp insatser utifrån Socialtjänstlagen (SoL) men även Lag med särskilda bestämmelser om vård av unga (LVU). Du ansvarar för att effektivisera arbetsprocesser och att tillvarata medarbetarnas resurser, utveckla samarbetet och samverkan så väl internt som externt.
   

  

 Vallentuna tillämpar ett tillitsbaserat ledarskap som bidrar till en arbetsmiljö där medarbetarna känner sig engagerade och motiverade att ha frihet att arbeta inom givna ramar. Ditt ledarskap ska syfta till att enheten levererar rättssäkra beslut i rätt tid till våra medborgare som leder till en personcentrerad myndighetsutövning med god kvalitet. Vi vill att du delar våra goda värderingar som innebär att ledarskapet bidrar till att skapa meningsfullhet för medarbetarna och alla våra samverkanspartners.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Socionomexamen
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som chef eller i ledande befattning, gärna inom myndighetsutövning
* Erfarenhet av myndighetsutövning inom barn och unga
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift
* God vana av att använda IT-verktyg som ett stöd i arbetet


**Personliga Egenskaper**
* Du försäkrar dig om att medarbetare, processer och resurser organiseras för att nå mål så effektivt som möjligt.
* Du förbättrar och ökar medarbetarnas kompetens, bygger chefs- och medarbetarrelationen, skapar delaktighet med samsyn om verksamheten och Vallentuna kommun.
* Du utvecklar, uppmuntrar innovation, lärande och skapar anpassning till externa förändringar
* Du är länken och representerar din verksamhet och Vallentuna kommun.
* Vallentunas värderingar syns i ditt och dina medarbetares beteenden
* Du är inspirerande och inkluderande, en ledare som både ser människorna bakom rollerna och har modet att leda med både hjärta och skärpa.
* Du är kunnig inom området, engagerad och har en tillitsbaserad ledarskapsstil.


**Information**
 Som arbetsgivare vill vi tillvarata de kvaliteter som en jämn könsfördelning och kulturell mångfald tillför. Vallentuna kommun satsar på kompetensutveckling och ett hållbart arbetsliv. För att ge så goda förutsättningar som möjligt har Vallentuna kommun en chefsakademi, för chefer och ledare, där du får utbildning och verktyg.
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidare på heltid med start enligt överenskomelse. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

*Inför all nyanställning utför Vallentuna kommun bakgrundskontroll.*
 För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen använder vi verktyget ReachMee. Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan genom att klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar/intresseanmälningar via e-post. Har du några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta angiven person i annonsen.
   

  

*I den här processen använder vi oss av testning i urvalet för att på ett fördomsfritt sätt kunna bedöma de egenskaper som är viktiga för tjänsten. Om vi bedömer att du uppfyller kvalifikationskraven kommer du att få en länk för testning inom kort.*
 Du är varmt välkommen att skicka din ansökan med ett personligt brev och CV senast 12 september.
   

  

**För Mer Information Kontakta**
 Frida Herman, Avdelningschef Myndighetsavdelningen
   

  

 08-587 84 827,
 **frida.herman@vallentuna.se**
 Mer information och fackliga representanter hittar du på https://www.vallentuna.se/naringsliv-och-arbete/arbeta-hos-oss/lokala-fackliga-foretradare/

title: Office & Mood Manager
description:
Är du den som alltid har koll på läget, älskar att skapa ordning och brinner för att göra arbetsplatsen till en plats där människor trivs?
   

  

 Vi på
 **Fenix** 
 söker nu en
 **Office & Mood Manager** 
 som vill vara navet i vår verksamhet och bidra till både struktur och en härlig kontorsmiljö.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Office & Mood Manager på Fenix ansvarar du för att kontoret fungerar optimalt från att välkomna gäster och hantera leveranser till att planera AW:s, kick-offs och större företagsevent. Du ser till att kontoret alltid är välfyllt, välkomnande och en plats där medarbetarna trivs och kan fokusera på sitt arbete.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande ena dagen kan du planera sommarfesten, nästa dag fylla på merchlagret eller göra frukost.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden:**
 Ansvara för kontorsdriften, inköp och kontakt med leverantörer.
   

  

 Organisera interna event såsom AW:s, sommarfest, julfest och kick-offs.
   

  

 Planera och boka resor vid behov.
   

  

 Hantera on- och offboarding tillsammans med IT och respektive chef.
   

  

 Uppdatera interna system (&frankly, Alexis) och hantera enklare administration.
   

  

 Ta emot gäster, telefonsamtal, leveranser och post.
   

  

 Säkerställa att kontoret alltid är rent, välfyllt och välkomnande – från fika och frukt till blommor och kaffe.
   

  

 Kvittoredovisning och budgetansvar inom ditt område.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
 Har en stark administrativ förmåga och är van att arbeta proaktivt.
   

  

 Är lösningsorienterad och tar egna initiativ.
   

  

 Har lätt för att bygga relationer och kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Trivs i en varierande roll där högt och lågt blandas.
   

  

 Har gymnasieutbildning och gärna erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

**Varför Fenix?**
 Fenix har sedan 2013 arbetat med några av Sveriges och Norges största publicister och medieföretag och har under de senaste åren även hjälpt företag i andra branscher att växa. Hos oss får du en arbetsplats med högt tempo, kreativa kollegor och en kultur där vi kombinerar hårt arbete med mycket skratt.
   

  

 Här blir du en nyckelperson i vårt dagliga arbete och får möjlighet att sätta din prägel på både kontoret och kulturen.
   

  

 📍
 **Plats:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 📅
 **Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 📄
 **Anställning:** 
 Heltid

title: Senior Web Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of globally distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer on the Web Engineering team to drive best practices across the team, for all disciplines, bringing great ideas to the table to lead technical conversations. They identify risks and communicate them to relevant stakeholders, asking the right questions to move a project forward. Within the team there are fantastic opportunities to gain deep technical knowledge of complex products in innovative and fast-growing areas of the tech world with space and support to hone your craft. We value transparency, intellectual honesty and teamwork.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer at Canonical, you will own the development of large projects. Encourages rigorous and efficient engineering process. Writes specifications and understands risks. Works to reduce complexity. Is capable of taking on technical lead responsibilities to drive an initiative to completion. Follows industry trends and new technologies. Capable of representing their team as a subject matter expert with cross-team credibility. An exemplary engineer who mentors and develops those around them in a structured and systematic manner, sharing this responsibility for their immediate team with their manager.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Identifying what matters for the team and driving initiatives to improve them
* Design and implement well-tested and documented software
* Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
* Leading in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
* Contribute to technical documentation to make it the best of its kind
* Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
* Deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Curate technical quality standards by designing the architectural approach to support business objectives
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above and beyond expectations
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Displays competency in researching new technology or approaches, and is able to tastefully and sustainably integrate changes and more modern approaches to technical projects.
* Provides comprehensive and insightful code review on items of any size within the project
* An eye for accessibility and performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events for up to two weeks each


 Nice-to-have skills
   

  

* Experience with container tech such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience fostering and maintaining a talented team by defining excellence
* REST API design, development and governance
* Drive to deliver performance engineering and security experience


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal-opportunity employer
   

  

*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background creates a better work environment and better products.* 
*Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration* 
*.*

title: Information Systems - Open Source Technical Architect
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200 colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office based roles.
